articles.title: Singleton on track for return after cancer surgery - ESPN
articles.description: Broncos linebacker Alex Singleton called his return to the practice field Wednesday less than three weeks after cancer surgery "a blessing'' and said he is "tracking'' to play Sunday night at Washington.

articles.title: QB Smith apologizes for obscene gesture to fans - ESPN
articles.description: Geno Smith apologized for making an obscene gesture toward fans as he walked off the field following a 24-10 loss to the Browns on Sunday. It's the second time he has made such a gesture toward fans since joining Las Vegas.

articles.description: After promising to stick to the current format, Players Era Festival CEO Seth Berger told ESPN that the event will consider a new one when next year's field expands to 32 teams.

articles.title: Matt Rhule Discusses Final Preparations for Iowa - Sports Illustrated
articles.description: The regular-season finale is closing in, and Matt Rhule and Nebraska know there aren't any secrets in what Iowa wants to do. But that means the Huskers will have to make plays, even with a freshman quarterback and late November weather.

articles.title: Oklahoma college basketball player dies after suffering injury during game in Texas - CBS News
articles.description: Connors State College sophomore Ethan Dietz died three days after he was injured during a game in Texas, the school said.

articles.title: The College Football Playoff Race Is Chaotic Because of Greed - Sports Illustrated
articles.description: College sports chased realignment money, bloated its leagues and broke competitive balance long before the 12-team playoff even got a chance.
